intro: Botherbe luteola, commonly known as the yellow willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
